content.question: A <math alttext="30 centimeter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>cm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> long solenoid with a cross-sectional radius of <math alttext="0.75 centimeter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.75</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>cm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> has 125 turns of wire. The solenoid is connected in series to a switch, a <math alttext="9 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>9</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> battery, and a <math alttext="10 ohms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext> </mtext><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> resistor. The switch is initially open and then is closed. The rate of change of current when the potential difference across the resistor is <math alttext="3 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is most nearly

<math alttext="1.2 times 10 to the positive 4 power amperes per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> </mtext><mfrac><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="7.8 times 10 to the positive 5 power amperes per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>7.8</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> </mtext><mfrac><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow><mrow><maction actiontype="highlight"><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></maction></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
